title: Indicator function
summary: In mathematics, an indicator function or a characteristic function of a subset of a set is a function that maps elements of the subset to one, and all other elements to zero. That is, if A is a subset of some set X, then 1 A ( x ) = 1 {\displaystyle \mathbf {1} _{A}(x)=1} if x ∈ A , {\displaystyle x\in A,} and 1 A ( x ) = 0 {\displaystyle \mathbf {1} _{A}(x)=0} otherwise, where 1 A {\displaystyle \mathbf {1} _{A}} is a common notation for the indicator function. Other common notations are I A , {\displaystyle I_{A},} and χ A . {\displaystyle \chi _{A}.}
